news.item: Porting Pingus to SDL is in progress, some spelling fixes for the

Time for some news, current plans for Pingus look like this:
Jave27 is currently trying to get the latest version in a release ready state
Grumbel opened a new branch in SVN called pingus-sdl, is supposed to port Pingus to SDL, level file format switch to S-Expr instead of

It's been a long time without any updates, so there's a couple of news to note here.
Pingus got elected GotM for April at The Linux Game Tome and a 0.7 release with many new features may be expected soon.
Pingus CVS was replaced by Subversion
There will be a new release on the stable branch (0.6.1) very soon now, planned date is 15.04.2004 - cross your fingers and hope. :-)
We've got now a Level Comment Tool where you can rate all levels which are delivered with Pingus.

A added little button in the bottom left corner of the that allows you to < href="https://www.paypal.com/xclick/business=grumbel%40gmx.de&item_name=Pingus+donation&no_note=1&tax=0&currency_code=EUR"> via Paypal.
Pingus 0.6.0 is finally out, has taken longer as expected, here it is. It contains one island with 22 playable levels. This is the first playable release ever of Pingus.
A second prerelease of Pingus 0.6.0 is out, named 0.6.0rc2, final 0.6.0 release is expected to be finished this weekend.
A first prerelease of Pingus 0.6.0 is out, named 0.6.

After some downtime the Pingus CVS repository is up and again. But since its now in another CVSROOT people with checkout need either to re checkout it or editor CVS/Root files a bit, more info is available here.
Another IRC Meeting is scheduled for the end of this week (07. Mar 2003) on Friday, 18:00 GMT. Server and channel stay the with the last one, see below. same. Everybody is welcome.

IRC Meeting planed for the next Saturday. For details see below and the Contact Section of this site.
Server:irc.freenode.net 6667
Channel:#pingus
Date:Saturday, 1. March 2003
Time:21:00 GMT
Rumour is that a new, finally playable, release will come out the next days... even so this isn't officially confirmed might cross your fingers and it will probably happen.

The Webpage got finally a complete redesign, this took, always, longer than expected, but anyway here it is. If you to know how this page is generated you can look at the source and the Makefiles in the < href="http://savannah.nongnu.org/cvs/?group=pingus">Savanna CVS tree.

< href="http://www.blender3d.com/">Blender, very powerfull 3D modelling software, become Free Software, but to accomplish they need to collect 100'000EUR. So if you to help Pingus and many other free projects, donate something to the Blender Foundation please.
< href="http://www.blender3d.com/">< src="http://www.blender3d.com/but150.gif" alt="Donate now, Blender3D" />
[Update: Blender now is Free Software, thanks to all donators!]
Updates are still not done, but we working on it... in the meantime you can go the < href="http://savannah.gnu.org/bugs/?func=addbug&group_id=2184">bugtracker and submit your favorit bugs in Pingus.

Mailing List and Bugtracking on the move to savanna
The bugtracking and mailing lists are on move to < href="https://savannah.gnu.org/projects/pingus/">http://savannah.gnu.org/projects/pingus/. Some of the info on this webpage therefore be out dated and needs updating, this should be done in a day or two.

The source for many Pingus images (.xcf, etc.) is available at < href="ftp://pingus.seul.org/pub/pingus/contrib/">ftp://pingus.seul.org/pub/pingus/contrib/. That directory contains everything that I in the development process, which is included in the official source tarball.

I have submitted Pingus to < href="http://unmaintained.sourceforge.net/">http://unmaintained.sourceforge.net/ now. Sorry, but I simply lack the time motivation to continue this project. So anybody wants to help coordinating project, they are more than welcome. drop a mail to < href="http://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/pingus-devel">pingus-devel in case you are interested to help.

Call help!
Pingus has currently 140 levels the XML format and another 40 levels in the PLF/PSM format, all these need to get reviewed, rated, fixed and/or converted. So if you some spare time, its now a good point to help! For a first overview you can get a list of all levels here. More detailed instructions on what you can do will soon.
some larger additions to the todo and a How to contribute guide
New ToDo list added here.
A short overview over the class structure available < href="sourcecodestructure.html">here.
'pingus.cx' is down, so you currently can't reach me grumbel@gmail.com, try < href="mailto:grumbel@gmail.com">grumbel@gmail.com instead.

Release 0.5.0pre2 is out
You can download it < href="download.html#devrel">here.

Pingus is in need for new programmers! As the month have shown this project is nearly dead, I simply lack the time to do anything for Pingus, so I some help. So when you are at least a bit familiar with C++ and have some spare time to offer, please drop < href="mailto:grumbel@gmail.com">me a mail, so I coordinate the efforts.

Pingus 0.5.0pre1 is out< /> Finally a new Pingus release is out, but be warned is a development release (mostly for level designers) and known to crash. When you want a playable game, this won't make you happy.
You can find a screenshot of the multiplayer mode here.

Multiplayer is on its way!
< href="mailto:grumbel@gmail.com">I am currently multiplayer support (split-screen, no network support) Pingus, cooperative and battle modes will be available.
Generated some source docs with doxygen, you can find them < href="http://pingus.seul.org/doxy/index.html">here

I cleaned up my Pingus directory tree, commited a bunch missing images and levels (more to come) and fixed some in the CVS version. Looks like this thing is alife again and new release might follow soon.

item.b: Project suspended for at least another month!
item.p: Due to the lack of time and motivation I will not work the project for at least another month, so don't expect updates in that time. In the meantime you can have a look some of my other projects:
